job_title: Full-time Faculty Member in Minneapolis, MN
pros: Student interaction due to smaller class sizes
cons: Understaffed departments can make semesters overwhelming

review_title: A good environment and mission; job satisfaction dependent on manager
pros:
Great mission, fantastic to see students succeed and exceed previous possibilities. 

You know you are making a difference and that your fellow instructors care

Benefits are excellent, especially in health
cons:
Your direct manager truly determines your advancement, enjoyment and sense of belonging in your position.

As with most education jobs, the salaries are low and the hours are long

pros: No summer classes, independent, fun job, a show of skills
cons: The school year was long, had to work two jobs to survive

job_title: Print Service Associate in Minneapolis, MN
pros: Flexible hours, kind staff, great work experience

cons: Extra hours are typical to meet all student and curriculum needs.

pros:
-Everybody is friendly
-It is a low stress job
cons:
-If you look for a fast paced job it is not your place
-Some roles are not clearly defined and result in confusion!

pros: The work is very rewarding.  Many of my students have progressed on in the industry and are doing well-paid work on high profile projects.  The organization has a great mission and delivers an education that will get any hard working student employed.  In the event of a student grading dispute, management was fair and supportive.  Co-workers are great, and management was professional and provided good overall leadership.  The position offered me a great opportunity to gain experience and make a contribution to the industry.
cons: Organizational support for evening-only instructors can be weak.  You have to take initiative to find your own solutions to problems.  Received very little in terms of course-support.  All courses needed full development of materials, quizzes and tests- which was much more time consuming then I had anticipated.  Some students come to the program with little or no motivation and can be disruptive and unruly.  It helps if you are a confident leader and can be very adaptive and motivated for your students.  This position isn't really for those seeking work-life balance.  Both the students and the instructors are often enduring the late hours for a period of time to better themselves with education or experience.

pros: The staff here is very flexible and accomodating on a personal level. They respect the skills and abilities that an employee possesses. There is an atmosphere of professionalism among both the staff and the students, who come from many walks of life. There is a lot of motivation to learn and work hard.
cons: There are limited student worker positions and sometimes many students are applying simultaneously, which can be challenging. These are listed online, but very frequent checking is a must.

pros: Great environment to learn in. Supportive staff and faculty. Helping students improve their lives.
cons: Many hats need to be worn by everyone in the department. Chain of command isn't always clearly defined.

pros:
Engages with business leaders of the local community. 
Constantly reviewing new technology impacting the community.
cons: Research needs to be a bigger part of the institution.

pros: 2nd year, student, i will graduate on May 2016.
cons:
-plans machining by blueprints, materials, specifications,drawings, dimensions and tolerances(GD&T)
